description: Validates that code was executed successfully (no errors, has output)

phases.name: validate
phases.instructions:
Check if the following content shows that code was executed successfully:

---
{{ input.content }}
---

Look for:
1. Actual execution output (numbers, results, print statements)
2. NO error messages (Exit code, Traceback, Error:, etc.)
3. Evidence that the solution worked

Return JSON:
{"valid": true, "reason": "..."} if code executed successfully with output
{"valid": false, "reason": "..."} if errors present or no execution happened

Be strict: Only return valid=true if you see ACTUAL execution output without errors.
